title: Ears treatment wheat with application maps / agrirouter Data Exchange

tasks.task: Operating farm management software for crop protection
subtasks: Navigating through the farm management software program
Selecting plant protection products for specific crops (e.g., winter wheat)
Adjusting application rates based on crop density and product specifications
Utilizing satellite images to create precise application maps
Saving application maps in the software for data transfer
Transferring application map data to the Agrarouter via the MyAmaRouter app
Ensuring the driver’s Amatron 4 terminal receives the application map for in-field use
Monitoring the driver’s progress and receiving the as-applied map after field work
Uploading the as-applied map to the farm management software for record-keeping

tasks.task: Coordinating data transfer and maintenance with staff
subtasks: Overseeing students working at the office
Collaborating with a company field representative for data duplication and troubleshooting
Addressing potential issues with data transfers, such as delay or technical assistance

tasks.task: Managing field operations for crop protection
subtasks: Supervising the application of plant protection products in specific areas (zones) of the fields
Adapting application rates based on satellite imagery analysis
Ensuring proper coverage andEvenness of application across different crop densities

tasks.task: Adapting to technical systems and processes
subtasks: Familiarizing oneself with the Zavio software for precision agriculture
Integrating the Agrarouter for data management and farm operations
Utilizing the MyAmaRouter app for real-time data transfer between office and field
Utilizing farm management software to track application tasks and as-applied data
Maintaining a record of crop treatments and their effectiveness
Analyzing data from previous applications to improve future crop protection strategies

tasks.task: Operating farm management software for crop protection. This would include tasks like navigation through the software, selecting appropriate plant protection products, adjusting rates based on crop density, using satellite images to create precise application maps. This uses the software as a tool to plan and execute treatments, focusing on precision.
Coordinating data transfer and operations with staff. This involves managing team members who assist in various tasks. Subtasks here would include:
Conducting field operations. The farmer needs to ensure that treatments are applied correctly in the fields. Subtasks might be:
